Just had a really good chat w/@julieplec. I learned Elena & friends have surprisingly good high school attendance.

I dunno if this is the future, but I'm watching Mad Men on my iPhone, so I'm sure I belong in some sort of montage.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) April 12, 2012

I await the day when Idol stops pretending @NBCTheVoice doesn't exist so Steven Tyler can ask Juliet Simms where she shops.

— Maggie Furlong (@MaggieFurlong) April 12, 2012

How many rave reviews of #Girls will you have to read before you stop saying, "I don't care! It looks DUMB!" Twitter. HOW MANY?

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) April 12, 2012

@JeremyMonjo I just hope it's not a californication for girls #girls

Pretty excited. Today I'm getting notes on my script "Dancing with Golda!" from Mel Gibson.

— Danny Zuker (@DannyZuker) April 12, 2012

Don't Trust the B in Apartment 23: A new letter moves to 123 Sesame Street to teach kids about the value of trust.

— Poe Daar-meron (@AndrewDaar) April 12, 2012

these hack cunt blog sites like VDclub and hitfix get very defensive 'cause they're all fucking sycophants that can't live without creatives

— kurt sutter (@sutterink) April 12, 2012

Shorter @sutterink: "I'm edgy."

— Scott Tobias (@scott_tobias) April 12, 2012

Kurt Sutter is like a racist but for critics. A criticist.

— Chris Becker (@crsbecker) April 12, 2012

@crsbecker @noelrk "I don't hate critics.....my cousin is a critic!"

— Adam Wright (@TVDoneWright) April 12, 2012

@crsbecker Do you think he's given a John Derbyshire-like Talk to his children about not being a Good Samaritan to critics in distress?

— Alyssa Rosenberg (@AlyssaRosenberg) April 12, 2012

If Kurt Sutter can't be happy on National Grilled Cheese Day, I guess he'll never be happy.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 12, 2012

Also, the recent defensiveness of certain TV writers boils down to them wailing "How dare you not love me?" while giving us virtual wedgies.

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) April 12, 2012

New reality show idea: Kurt Sutter, Veena Sud, and Ricky Gervais track down and kill all who displease them. Er, wait.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) April 12, 2012

@televisionary @zhandlen please hire Chevy Chase to be their mentor!

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) April 12, 2012

@televisionary @TVGMDamian @zhandlen Sterling Cooper Sutter Chase would be just about the best PR firm EVAR.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) April 12, 2012

I know I should ignore Sutter, but his lunacy is so entertaining (like Charlie Sheen); F/X should give Sutter his own… wait.

— Poe Daar-meron (@AndrewDaar) April 12, 2012

I don't understand the point of what Kurt Sutter is doing today. Any1? Can he show us on the doll exactly where the TV bloggers touched him?

— Kim (@kkjordan) April 12, 2012

Fellow, TV critics, based on the hurtful things Kurt Sutter is saying about us, is there any way we can send Mario Lopez to his front door?

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) April 12, 2012

Either Sutter would stop bullying us, or he'd feed Mario Lopez to something chained in his basement. It's a win-win situation.

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) April 12, 2012

My dream is to be a showrunner somewhere between the insanity of Tina Fey's diplomacy and @sutterink's cool as fuck insanity.

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) April 12, 2012

tweets.html:
No new ep of The Vampire Diaries tonight. Next meeting of the VDclub postponed until next week. (cc: @sutterink ) #TVD

Hello twitter...nice to meet you.

Guys, shhhh: I am inside Fox News HQ. He he he! I'm going to report on everything I can possibly oops hang on I've been caught.

Cheer up, North Korea. You may not have launched a rocket, but you've managed to launch thousands of dick jokes.

the only thing Kim Jong Un is qualified to take over is Courtney Love's Twitter profile.
